title: Understanding the Quotient Rule
text: The Quotient Rule allows you to simplify expressions where one term is divided by another. When dividing terms with the same base, you can subtract the exponents.

title: Identifying the Base
text: In the given expression $$\frac{{\left(z \sqrt{2}\right)}^5}{z \sqrt{2}}$$, the base is the repeated element inside the division, which is $$z \sqrt{2}$$.

title: Calculate the Exponent Change
text: What is the simplified exponent when subtracting the exponent of the denominator from the exponent of the numerator?

title: Applying the Exponent Rule
text: When dividing powers with the same base, subtract the exponents of the denominator from the numerator. This helps combine the expression into a single power term.

title: Simplifying the Expression
text: Apply what you know about the quotient rule to write the expression $$\frac{{\left(z \sqrt{2}\right)}^5}{z \sqrt{2}}$$ as a single power.
